author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਜੋ ਸਿਮਰੈ ਤਿਸ ਕੀ ਗਤਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਪੀਵਤ ਬਹੁੜਿ ਨ ਜੋਨਿ ਭ੍ਰਮਾਮ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Whoever meditates on it, is saved; drinking it in, the mortal does not wander in reincarnation again. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jō simarai tis kī gat hōvai pīvat bahur n jōn bhramām .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:

translation.text: It is my worship, meditation, austerity and cleansing bath.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. translation.text: Meditating in remembrance on the Naam, I have become free of desire. ||2||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. translation.text: It is my domain and empire, wealth, mansion and court.

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮ ਮਿਥਿਆ ਸਭ ਛਾਰੁ ॥੪॥੮॥

translation.text: Without the Lord's Name, everything is false and worthless, like ashes. ||4||8||

transliteration.text: bin har nām mithiā sabh shār .4.8.

text: ਲੇਪੁ ਨ ਲਾਗੋ ਤਿਲ ਕਾ ਮੂਲਿ ॥

translation.text: The poison had absolutely no harmful effect.

transliteration.text: lēp n lāgō til kā mūl .

text: ਦੁਸਟੁ ਬ੍ਰਾਹਮਣੁ ਮੂਆ ਹੋਇ ਕੈ ਸੂਲ ॥੧॥

translation.text: But the wicked Brahmin died in pain. ||1||

transliteration.text: dusat brāhaman mūā hōi kai sūl .1.

text: ਪ੍ਰਭ ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਅਪਣੇ ਦਾਸ ਕਾ ਰਖਵਾਲਾ ॥

translation.text: God is the Mother, the Father and the Protector of His slave.

transliteration.text: prabh māt pitā apanē dās kā rakhavālā .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. text: ਨਿੰਦਕ ਕਾ ਮਾਥਾ ਈਹਾਂ ਊਹਾ ਕਾਲਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The face of the slanderer, here and hereafter, is blackened. ||3||

transliteration.text: nindak kā māthā īhānh ūhā kālā .3.

text: ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਕੀ ਪਰਮੇਸਰਿ ਸੁਣੀ ਅਰਦਾਸਿ ॥

translation.text: The Transcendent Lord has heard the prayer of servant Nanak.

transliteration.text: jan nānak kī paramēsar sunī aradās .

text: ਖੂਬੁ ਖੂਬੁ ਖੂਬੁ ਖੂਬੁ ਖੂਬੁ ਤੇਰੋ ਨਾਮੁ ॥

translation.text: Excellent, excellent, excellent, excellent, excellent is Your Name.

text: ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਦੁਨੀ ਗੁਮਾਨੁ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: False, false, false, false is pride in the world. ||1||Pause||
